title: Is time travel real? And has anyone in history ever went back in time or into the future? - Quora

response.answer_text: For time travel to be possible, it must be necessarily true that past, present, and future are all already ‘authored’ and in some sense ‘happening’. It is interesting that you ask if anyone in _history_ has done it. It is far more likely that someone from the future has done it. If time travel is physically possible, requiring just a human to discover the method for doing it, then time travel becomes ever more likely the further into the future one goes. And it is binary whether they _actually_ eventually invent it or not. That means there is a 50% chance that the future contains time travellers, and since all of the future has ‘already happened’, there’s a good chance that time travellers from the future are in our present, right now!

unless somehow done by magical means, i doubt it could occur outside of a quantum scale. it’s said that tachyons appear to move backwards in time. plus, if you traveled in time, wouldn’t you be introducing mass to an already completed, perhaps closed state?? IE: the universe. if point:A is the past. and point:B is the present, and we traveled back in time, the particles that make-up ‘us’ would already exist in other forms of congruence. i mean, if the law of conservation is valid, there’s never been any new matter or energy produced. so if the universe has always been ‘mass-completed’ from the beginning, but just rearranging it’s particles into different forms(PLANETS/RADIATION/SUNS/GALAXIES etc.) then it could be like introducing gas into a balloon that’s always filled to capacity. ‘POP!!’
